html: (1 Nephi 20:4)."Thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass." In more modern terminology the obstinate or stubborn of Israel could be described as having necks that would not turn they were stiffnecked; and their minds were not pliant to the promptings of the Spirit they were hardheaded. A stiff neck does not turn in the direction of divine guidance. By contrast, the Lord promises to "feel after" those who "stiffen not their necks." (D&C 112:13.)
